page.title: 15Interesting People
page.content: We visited William Neil, the poet. Before he retired he was an English teacher in our school, and before that he was a navigator in the R.A.F. He lives just outside Crossmichael with his wife, who is also a retired teacher. He was quite old when he went to Edinburgh University to study English and Celtic languages. He is an unusual because he writes in the 3 languages of Scotland - Scots (Lallans), English and Gaelic. In 1969 he was crowned Bard at the Gaelic Mod. He loves living in the country and he writes many poems about our area. He is also concerned about the condition of Scotland and of Europe, and he writes about this as well. He is editor of "Lallans", the Scots language magazine. His latest book of poems is called "Wild Places"
